chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan M. Palmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to dismiss but read in.  Court dismisses but reads in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary Hearing 8/5/16

Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai has received information and enters not guilty plea.  Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.
Arraignment on October 3, 2016 at 11:00 am.
for joinder

Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Rick Speontgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Off. Joshua Hoege for RPD.  State notes PH's will be proceeding today w/prelims in all but 13CT277 and 16CF149.  15CF273 a motion to dismiss has been filed and a motion to revoke the DPA has been filed.  15CF273 there is a motion to dismiss filed by DE.  13CT277 has been tracking and is now waiting for hearing to revoke the DPA.  Atty Tsai responds to motions filed.  State addresses 13CT277 - would like that to be closed today if possible so DE isn't facing any more bailjumping charges.  Atty Tsai responds/they are not ready to proceed w/that motion in 13CT277.  15CF273 is a motion to dismiss and the State is ready to proceed.  Court in 13CT277 will order it be set for a seperate motion hearing to revoke this matter.  Court notes motion to dismiss in 15CF273.  Atty Tsai states his argument to the Court re: his motion to dismiss in 15CF273.  State responds/notes they intend to file a motion for joinder when today's hearings are complete.  Parties argue.  Court denies motion to dismiss in 15CF273.  State notes charges that are going to be addressed at prelim today.  Atty Tsai requests they all be done individually.  State responds.  State calls Off. Joshua Hoege - RPD - S&T in 15CF217.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  State makes closing argument.  Atty Puck makes closing argument.  State responds.  Court finds probable cause for DE to be bound over in 15CF217.  State calls Off. Hoege in 15CF269 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  State does re-direct.  Court finds probable cause in 15CF269 and binds DE over.  Court requests a time reference as to how long to complete these matters.  Notes these might have to be set over until later today.  State calls Off. Hoege in 15CF273 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Atty Tsai does closing argument.  State does rebuttal closing.  Court finds probable cause in 15CF273 and binds DE over.  State calls Off. Hoege again in 16CF7 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Atty Tsai makes argument.  Court finds probable cause as to 16CF7 and binds DE over.  State calls Off. Hoege in 16CF31 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Court finds probable cause in 16CF31 and binds over.  State calls 16CF83 - Off. Hoege already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Court interrupts Atty Tsai and finds probable cause in 16CF83 and binds over.  State calls Off. Hoege again in 16CF165 - already sworn.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Tsai does cross-exam.  Court interrupts Atty Tsai again and finds probable cause and binds over in 16CF165 also.  State notes prelim was already held in 16CF149.  Court notes matter can be set for futher hearings.  Atty Tsai notes they are objecting to any probable cause being found in re: to his client.  Court notes.  State notes DE already received informations today and files originals in Court.  Arraignment to be set.  Bonds continued in all matters.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai requests stayed warrants be quashed.  Court quashes warrants.  Atty Tsai requests all matters be set over for a PTC/RD so he can discuss all nine matters w/DA.  State requests prelims be set in all matters except 16CF149 and 13CT277 as some of the matters are over a year old.  Atty Tsai responds.  Court sets all matters for Bonds continued in all matters.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Return date on July 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states all cases.  Court notes DE called and said he couldn't get a ride.  Atty Tsai requests 48 hr stay of any requested warrant.  State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrants but stays them until 7/22/2016.  Return date scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Return date scheduled for July 22, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on July 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai gives status.  Request a new status conf to see if Attorney Tsai has been appointed on the now withdrawn cases of Attorney Southworth.  State request return to have defendant present.  Attorney Tsai request status without defendant's appearance required due to pending appointment of other cases.  Will be awaiting discovery on those cases after appointment.  Questions efficiency of return date at this time.  Defendant does not have a valid DL at this point yet.  Transportation is an issue.  Court questions Attorney Tsai on the resolution status.  Court resets matters.  Return date scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on June 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  New charges pending. No agreement reached at this point.  Attorney Southworth agrees and gives status.  Request status in 2-3 weeks to sort out a possible plea agreement.  Attorney Tsai agrees.  Court request parties get a date from Br. 2 in the next 2-3 weeks, off the 1 p.m. calendar.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 21, 2016 at 11:15 am.

Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Return date on April 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises matters need joint PTC and returns to discuss matters further.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
body
Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reset with all other cases.  Return date scheduled for March 31, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant Ryan M. Palmer not in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

Pre-trial conference at 02-19-2016 10:00 am.
Return date at 03-01-2016 01:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan M. Palmer in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney/waived.  DE states he has counsel but not in this case.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $3,250.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.  Return date scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 10:00 am.
